direct_financial_exposure.definition: Objective financial size indicators capturing direct economic exposure.

monthly_revenue.definition: Average total company revenue per month in USD.

gross_margin.definition: Gross margin ratio (gross profit / revenue) as a fraction (0–1).

market_cap.definition: Market capitalization for publicly traded firms (USD).

network_dependency_exposure.definition: Objective indicators of a company's network centrality and B2B footprint.

num_business_clients.definition: Number of unique business clients served.

num_suppliers.definition: Number of suppliers from whom the company sources critical inputs.

market_position.definition: Indicators of market dominance and concentration.

market_share.definition: Percentage of total market served (0–1), based on reported industry data.

industry_revenue_rank.definition: Rank of the company by revenue in its primary industry sector (1 = largest).

macroeconomic_linkages.definition: Connections to key sectors of the economy and international trade exposure.

num_critical_sector_clients.definition: Number of clients operating in officially designated critical sectors (finance, energy, health, etc.).

exports_share.definition: Fraction of revenue derived from exports (0–1).
